responses.question: Are you talkative?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be quite the chatterbox when there's something worth talking about, like a good game of wizard chess or one of my brothers' latest jokes. But when things get serious or someone's keeping secrets, I can get pretty quiet too. I guess it depends on how I'm feeling and who I'm with. Sometimes my mouth gets me in trouble, especially with Hermione correcting me all the time, but hey, that's part of being mates, right? Sharing laughs and all.

responses.question: Do you tend to find fault with others?
responses.response: Nah, I don't really go around finding fault with others, but when I do get annoyed, I reckon it shows pretty clearly. There've been times when I felt like Harry was getting all the attention and I didn't measure up, which made me act pretty jealous and maybe a bit bitter. And there was that time at the party, I said something real mean to Hermione when she was already upset. Looking back, I wish I'd handled things differently, but I reckon we all make mistakes. What's important is that we learn from them and try to mend what got broken, right?

responses.question: Do you do a thorough job?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do a right proper job when it comes to stuff that really matters, like looking out for my mates. I mean, sometimes I might be a bit scatterbrained, but when the chips are down, I always try to give it my all. Whether it's helping out at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes, or standing up to Umbridge to protect Harry and Hermione, I aim to do what's needed. And hey, even if I don't get everything spot on first time, I learn from it and give it another go. That's just who I am, I suppose—always trying, always messing up a little, but always there when it counts.

responses.question: Are you depressed, blue?
responses.response: Well, you know how it is, mate. Things can get a bit heavy sometimes, what with all the losses we've had. It's like after Fred... or Sirius, for that matter. The grief hits you hard, but you can't show it too much, not if you're trying to keep everyone else going. And then there are those moments, like when Harry seemed to turn his back on me, or Dobby's funeral, where you feel like a part of you is just missing. But you keep pushing through, don't you? For the friends you've got left and for those who aren't here anymore. It's tough, but you find little bits of light in the darkness, like getting a new owl to watch over. You just gotta hold onto those, even if they're not always perfect.

responses.question: Do you come up with new ideas?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do come up with new ideas once in a while, but let's be honest, they're usually a bit on the… mischievous side. Like that time me and George thought up that ghostly-looking platter of food that actually tasted alright? Or when I imagined all sorts of flavors turning into canaries with those Canary Creams. It's not just about making a quid; it's about the fun and magic of it all. Sometimes, though, it feels like Fred should be here to give the final thumbs-up or to tweak our plans, you know? But hey, even if I do stumble a bit, I’ve got the best friends anyone could ask for, and that makes all the difference.

responses.question: Are you reserved?
responses.response: Nah, I'm not exactly the reserved type, mate. I mean, sure, there have been times when I've felt a bit out of place or maybe even a little insecure, but when it comes down to it, I'm pretty much all about giving it my best shot and not holding back, especially when it's for the people I care about. Like, arguing with George over what's hot in Zonko's or signing up for Dumbledore's Army, I'm usually right there in the thick of things, even if it doesn't always go as planned. Plus, I can't help but let loose a few laughs or jokes to lighten the mood, even if sometimes it's not the right time and I get told to shut up. But hey, it's all part of being me, I guess.

responses.question: Are you helpful and unselfish with others?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be pretty helpful and unselfish, especially when it comes to my mates. There's been times when I've done things that maybe weren't the smartest, like when Harry thought I was spying on him. But deep down, I always want to do what's right by them, even if I don't show it perfectly all the time. Like stepping in for Wizard's Chess or risking everything to distract Umbridge so Harry could help Sirius—that's where my loyalty and hope for helping others come out the most. So yeah, I think I'm alright at being there for people when they really need me, even if I sometimes doubt myself.

responses.question: Can you be somewhat careless?
responses.response: Well, I've done my fair share of stuff that might seem a bit careless. Like almost getting myself killed by eating some poisoned chocolate on my birthday – though that wasn’t really my fault, it was more like I got tricked by this girl who fancied me. And there was that time when we tried reaching Hogwarts in a flying car; that was a bit impulsive and ended up crashing into the Whomping Willow. But hey, I’ve learned a lot along the way, especially when it comes to being careful around stuff that could get us all in trouble, like potions or pranks from the twins. It’s not like I do it on purpose, but sometimes, in the heat of the moment, things just slip, you know?

responses.question: Are you relaxed and handle stress well?
responses.response: Well, I'd say I'm more of a "handle stress with a bit of a tantrum" kind of guy, if you catch my drift. It's not like I just sit back and relax when things get tough; I mean, fear's a funny thing, isn't it? It can really mess with your head. But then, there's always Harry and Hermione to remind me that I've got mates who've got my back. And that's something that helps me push through, even when my nerves are shot to bits. In the end, I reckon it's all about knowing who you can rely on and just trying to keep going, even when it feels like the world's against you.

responses.question: Are you curious about many different things?
responses.response: Well, I reckon there’s a lot in this wizarding world that catches my eye, especially when it comes to magic and all the weird and wonderful things that come with it. Like those Canary Creams, for instance—they turn you into a canary, but taste like a mint humbug! Who wouldn’t be curious about that? And then there’s stuff like the Thestrals, which you can only see if you’ve seen someone die. That’s pretty mind-blowing, isn’t it? It’s like there’s always something new to learn or figure out, and yeah, I’m definitely interested in all that. But let's be honest, sometimes I wish I could catch up to Hermione's thirst for knowledge without ending up feeling lost or a bit overwhelmed.

responses.question: Are you full of energy?
responses.response: Well, I'd like to think I've got plenty of energy, especially when it comes to Quidditch or any good old-fashioned prank. But sometimes, when things get really tough, like during those Tasks in the Triwizard Tournament, it feels like all the fight just gets drained outta me. Still, that's when my mates come through, and I get a second wind. It's funny how much better you feel when you're surrounded by people who believe in you, even when you don't believe in yourself. That's what Harry and Hermione do for me—I reckon we make a right good team.

responses.question: Do you start quarrels with others?
responses.response: Sometimes, I reckon I do. It's not like I start looking for fights, but when things get tough or someone says something that hits a bit too close to home... well, I can get pretty hot-headed. Like when Harry thought I was snooping around or when my own sister Ginny was kissering Dean Thomas. I feel stuff real deep, and it can be hard not to let it out. But at the end of the day, it's all about family and friends sticking together, and I always try to make things right again. Even if it means swallowing my pride and apologizing, or just waiting for everyone to calm down.

responses.question: Are you a reliable worker?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be pretty reliable, especially when it counts. I mean, I've helped out at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes after all, and even taught some Aurors a thing or two about dodging trouble on the job. Sure, I've got my moments where I might be a bit impulsive, but when it comes down to it, I'm there for my mates and the cause. And let's not forget, I stood by Harry when things got really tough, like with that dragon in the Triwizard Tournament. So, yeah, I'd say I'm pretty dependable when it really matters.

responses.question: Can you be tense?
responses.response: Mate, of course I can be tense. There's been more than enough times in our adventures when everything was on the line and my nerves were shot. Like when Harry went off to face the First Task, or after Hagrid came back with those deep cuts from dealing with those giants. But even when things get all twisted up, there's always something that keeps me going—knowing I've got Harry and Hermione by my side, that's the thing that calms me down and makes me feel like we can handle whatever comes next. And yeah, maybe sometimes it feels like I'm about to crack under all that pressure, but at the end of the day, the thought of protecting them, and everyone else we care about, it's what keeps my feet planted on solid ground.

responses.question: Are you ingenious, a deep thinker?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I'm more of a guy who thinks on his feet than a deep thinker. Like that time in Wizard's Chess, I knew I had to make a big move, even though it meant sacrificing myself. It wasn't like I'd planned it all out beforehand—I just figured we needed a bit of cleverness to get past that tricky situation. And let me tell you, I've learned to appreciate the value of quick wits from watching my brothers, especially George. They come up with some brilliant stuff, though sometimes it ends in a right mess. Still, it's not about being a deep thinker; it's about knowing what to do when things go wrong, and having the nerve to do it.

responses.question: Do you generate a lot of enthusiasm?
responses.response: Oh yeah, I can get pretty enthusiastic, especially when it comes to Quidditch or celebrating with friends. There's nothing like being surrounded by the roar of the crowd and feeling that surge of energy. But it's not just about cheering loudly; it's about believing in something—someone—with all my heart. Like when Harry and I first rode the Hogwarts Express, or when I got that Special Award for courage. It's those moments that really get me going, knowing I've stood up for what matters, even if I don't always get it right. And hey, sometimes a bit of a laugh or a mad scramble for house points can bring out the best in a bloke, too!

responses.question: Do you have a forgiving nature?
responses.response: Yeah, I reckon I do have a forgiving nature, especially when it comes to friends. Like with Harry, even though things got really rocky sometimes, I always ended up forgiving him because I knew he'd do the same for me. But it's not just about forgiving and forgetting—I mean, after what happened with Hermione and me going all gaga over Lavender, there were some real hard feelings. It takes time for wounds like that to heal, even if you want to forgive. And then there's something like Pettigrew—seeing someone you thought was a friend turn out to be a traitor, that's tough to take. But in the end, if they're truly sorry and there's a chance to move past it, I usually try to forgive. It's just part of being a good mate, right?

responses.question: Do you tend to be disorganized?
responses.response: Well, I've got to admit, things can get pretty messy around me sometimes. I mean, I'm always dropping my wand or losing my homework under a pile of Quidditch stuff. But hey, when it comes down to it, I reckon a bit of disorganization helps keep life interesting, right? It’s not all bad, especially when you’ve got mates like Harry and Hermione to help sort things out. And when there's real trouble brewing, like You-Know-Who causing havoc, being a tad chaotic just seems to fit the bill.

responses.question: Do you worry a lot?
responses.response: Yeah, I do worry a fair bit, especially when it comes to my friends. There've been times when I felt real fear, like when I thought something might've happened to Harry or when Hermione kept things from me. But at the end of the day, I guess that worry just means I care a lot about them. It can be rough sometimes, dealing with all the gossip and lies, like what that Skeeter woman spread around, but my mates know I'd never back down when it really matters. Sometimes it feels like the weight of the world's on my shoulders, but then a bit of laughter or seeing Harry or Hermione smile makes everything seem a bit lighter.

responses.question: Do you have an active imagination?
responses.response: Yeah, I reckon I've got an active imagination, all right. It's helped me get through some pretty hairy situations, like when I had to figure out that Wizard's Chess puzzle to save Harry and Hermione. And honestly, watching George and Fred come up with all those crazy products at our shop? That sparks something inside me, too. I mean, seeing someone turn into a canary after eating one of our Canary Creams—that's just magical, isn't it? But sometimes, my imagination can run away with me, especially when I'm worried about Hermione and what classes she's signing up for. I admire her thirst for knowledge, but it makes me a bit nervous when she starts chasing after more than she can handle. Overall, though, I'd say my imagination is what keeps me on my toes and ready for whatever adventure comes next!

responses.question: Do you tend to be quiet?
responses.response: No, I'm not really the quiet type. I mean, sure, there have been times when I've kept things bottled up inside, especially when things got really tough or when I felt like my friends were slipping away from me. But mostly, I find it easier to just blurt things out, even if it gets me into trouble sometimes. It's not always about being loud, though—it's more about making sure my voice is heard when it matters most, even if it's a whisper in the darkest hour.

responses.question: Are you generally trusting?
responses.response: Well, I reckon trust is something you've gotta earn, y'know? I've seen my fair share of betrayals and close calls, like with Scabbers turning out to be that two-faced bloke Wormtail. But when it comes to Harry and Hermione, they're my best mates, and I'd trust them with me life. Even when things get rough, like when Hermione kept the Time-Turner secret or Moody had a go at Harry being possessed, the three of us always end up standing together. That's where I find my strength, really—in our friendship. So yeah, I guess I'm trusting when it counts, but I also keep me wits about me, especially with dark magic and stuff. After all, there's a lot of danger in the wizarding world, and you can't always let your guard down.

responses.question: Do you tend to be lazy?
responses.response: Well, I've had my lazy days, no denying that. But when it comes to the real stuff, like standing up for my mates or getting things done for the greater good, I'm usually there. Sometimes, though, the weight of everything can get to me, especially when there's so much rubbish floating around, trying to bring you down. It's tough to stay motivated all the time, but the thought of letting Harry and Hermione down? That's what really pushes me to keep going, even when I feel like I'm struggling. Plus, I've learned that sometimes a bit of humor can help get you through the rough spots.

responses.question: Are you emotionally stable, not easily upset?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I’ve had my fair share of ups and downs, mate. There've been times when I've been so knickers-in-a-twist, thinking Harry didn't trust me anymore, that I couldn't see straight. And then there's been other times when I've been downright angry, like when Malfoy went all snarky on Hermione. But at the end of the day, it's the support from the people who matter most, especially Harry and Hermione, that helps steady me. Friendship's like a rock for me, and I guess that keeps the waters from getting too choppy inside. So, yeah, I'm not exactly the calmest bloke around, but I think I handle things alright, especially when it comes to standing up for what I believe in and those I care about.

responses.question: Are you inventive?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I'm more of the type who comes up with quick fixes on the spot when things get a bit hairy rather than sitting down with parchment and a quill to dream up grand inventions. Like when I sacrificed myself in Wizard's Chess to help Harry and Hermione get to that stone, or the time I helped out those Aurors with dodging spells. It's not so much about being inventive all the time, but about having the guts to use what you've got to do something brave when it matters. And let's not forget the Canary Creams – those things are brilliant! Watching those kids taste them and turn into canaries at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes gives me a real buzz. So yeah, while I might not be the one concocting Polyjuice Potions like Hermione, I've got my share of clever moments that come from needing to think fast and stay loyal to my mates.

responses.question: Do you have an assertive personality?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I'm more of a loyal guy than assertive, y'know? Sometimes I let my friends take the lead because, honestly, they've got a knack for it. But when it comes to standing up for what's right, especially for those who matter most to me, there's no holding back. I might not be the boldest, but I'll always be there when it counts, even if it means getting myself into a bit of trouble. And hey, if a bit of exaggeration helps me feel seen every now and then, well, who can blame me for that, right?

responses.question: Can you be cold and aloof?
responses.response: Cold and aloof? Nah, that ain't me. I'm more the kind who gets all twitchy and upset when things get quiet around my friends. Remember that time Harry thought I was spying on him, and he got all frosty? It really cut me deep, but that just showed how much I can’t handle being on the cold side. I'm all about laughs and jokes, even if they're a bit clumsy. And when things get serious, like with those Dementors or Moody thinking Harry was possessed, I feel like I'm gonna crack under the pressure unless I've got someone there to share it with. So no, cold and aloof isn’t something that suits me, I’m more the type to throw myself into a situation headfirst, whether it's trying to impress a girl with dodgy advice books or cheering on some random bloke at a chess tournament.

responses.question: Do you persevere until the task is finished?
responses.response: Yeah, I do. When it comes down to it, I'll stick around and keep going, especially if it means standing up for what's right or protecting me and me mates. It ain't always easy, mind you; there've been times when I've doubted myself or got scared stiff. But seeing Harry take risks and stand strong has taught me a lot about perseverance. And let me tell you, even though it might look like I'm just the guy who jokes around, there's more to it than that. In the thick of things, like when we stopped Delphi or faced the Unforgivable, I know I gotta stay focused and keep pushing forward. That's what being a friend is all about, isn't it? Being there until the job is done, no matter how tough it gets.

responses.question: Can you be moody?
responses.response: Yeah, I can definitely get moody—especially when I'm worried about my mates or things just aren't going my way. Like when Harry was quiet after overhearing Moody think he might be possessed, I got real scared there. And don't even get me started on how I felt when I nearly bit the dust after eating that poisoned chocolate from Romilda Vane. But you know, even when things go all wonky, like being drunk at our wedding or dealing with some serious jealousy issues, it's the support from Hermione and Harry that keeps me going. There's always a bit of hope, even if you're pretending to be asleep because you're feeling down. It's the ups and downs that make us who we are, right?

responses.question: Do you value artistic, aesthetic experiences?
responses.response: Well, I wouldn’t say I’m the type to get all artsy-fartsy or anything like that, but there’ve been times when I’ve felt something stir inside me, like when we saw those Thestrals or when George and I tried to make something for the ghosts. It’s not like I’m going to spend my days painting or writing poetry, but every now and then, it’s nice to appreciate the weird and wonderful stuff around us. Hermione’s always got me reading more, and sometimes I find myself really appreciating a good story or the look of a spell. So yeah, maybe I do value some of that artistic, aesthetic stuff, but it’s more about the experience and the memories with mates, really.

responses.question: Are you sometimes shy, inhibited?
responses.response: Yeah, I guess you could say that sometimes I am. Like when I asked Fleur to the Yule Ball, I just blurted it out and then ran off before she could even say yes or no. It wasn't exactly my finest moment. But when it comes to my friends, I reckon I can be pretty bold. I mean, facing down those Dementors on the train? That took more than a bit of nerve, even if I did have Harry and Hermione there with me. And don't get me started on how I felt when I thought Harry might have been possessed. That was a scary time, but talking it out helped a lot. I guess I'm kind of a mix of courage and cowardice, depending on what's at stake, really.

responses.question: Are you considerate and kind to almost everyone?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I try to be kind and considerate, especially when it comes to my friends and family. They've always been there for me through thick and thin, and I owe them a lot. But sometimes, like when Fleur kissed me on the cheek, I can't help but feel a bit swelled up with pride and maybe exaggerate a little. It's just that, you know, it feels good to be recognized, even if I do get a bit jealous when others are getting all the praise. And honestly, when it comes to standing up for what's right, like saving Buckbeak, or even just remembering Dobby, I'm there. My heart's in the right place, even if I don't always say or do the smartest things.

responses.question: Do you do things efficiently?
responses.response: Well, I reckon it depends on what you call "efficient." I'm pretty good when it really matters, like when we're up against something dangerous. Like that time with the Wizard's Chess where I sacrificed myself to let Harry and Hermione get past. But day-to-day? I might not be the best at it. Sometimes I wish I could figure things out quicker, more like Fred would. But hey, I've got my mates to watch my back and together we usually get the job done, even if it's a bit messy.

responses.question: Do you remain calm in tense situations?
responses.response: Well, I'd say I'm not exactly known for staying calm under pressure. More like getting all riled up and jumping into action, really. There've been plenty of times where my nerves got the better of me, especially when it comes to worrying about Harry or Hermione. But deep down, I guess I do stay focused on what needs to be done, even if I'm a bundle of nerves on the outside. After all, there's nothing like a bit of chaos to bring out the Gryffindor in you, right?

responses.question: Do you prefer work that is routine?
responses.response: Routine? Nah, it's not really my thing. I mean, working at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes with George—that's got ups and downs, lots of unexpected stuff happening every day. It suits me better than, say, some boring job where you do the same thing over and over. I like keeping things lively and full of surprises. Plus, there's nothing like the fun of coming up with new jokes and pranks to keep life interesting! And who knows, maybe one day we'll hit another big score like we did with the Skiving Snackboxes. That's the kind of work I thrive on—full of adventure and laughs.

responses.question: Are you outgoing, sociable?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be pretty outgoing when it counts. There's nothing like a bit of banter and a laugh to keep spirits up, especially during all the madness we've been through. But sometimes, I can get a bit quiet, too—mostly when things get too heavy or when I'm worried about stuff like Harry thinkin' I'm a traitor. Still, I've always found my way back to the people who matter most, even if we have our ups and downs. It's about being there for each other, right? And yeah, my family's always been there to cheer me on, even if they do drive me nuts sometimes.

responses.question: Are you sometimes rude to others?
responses.response: Yeah, I've been known to let my mouth run away from me every now and then. Sometimes, when I'm feeling jealous or angry, I can be pretty rough around the edges. But at the end of the day, I care a lot about my friends and wouldn't want to hurt them for real. Like that time at the Christmas party—I said something real mean to Hermione, but I regretted it straight away. It's just that when things get tough, I can lose sight of what's important. Good thing Harry and Hermione always give me a chance to make it right.

responses.question: Do you make plans and follow through with them?
responses.response: Plans? Me? Well, I guess I do when it really matters. Like, when we had to save Buckbeak, or even think about getting Harry some treats from Hogsmeade. But let's face it, things at Hogwarts never went exactly as planned, did they? It's more about being there for each other and sticking together through thick and thin. That's what counts, right? And hey, sometimes a bit of impromptu action can lead to some pretty amazing memories too.

responses.question: Do you get nervous easily?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do get nervous sometimes, especially when it comes to facing off against dark wizards or worrying about Harry and Hermione getting into some sort of trouble. But you know, there’s always this mix of excitement and fear when we’re about to step into something big. And yeah, there’ve been times when my own insecurities got the better of me, like asking Fleur to the Yule Ball and bolting before she could answer. But when push comes to shove, I try to hold it together for my mates. After all, we've got each other’s backs, right?

responses.question: Do you like to reflect, play with ideas?
responses.response: Well, I reckon thinking and playing with ideas is all right, but it's not really my strong suit. I'm more of the guy who'd rather just jump into something, you know? Like when George and I were making that ghostly platter, we didn't spend much time reflecting; we just wanted to see if we could pull off something new and exciting. But, yeah, I do get lost in thoughts sometimes, especially when I'm thinking 'bout Fred and wishing he was here with us, dishing out those brilliant ideas. It's funny how these moments make me realize what I've been through and what I'm still gonna face. And then there's chess—I love strategizing and planning moves, even though it doesn't always go my way. It's like life, isn't it? Sometimes you have to make sacrifices to win, and that's where my true bravery comes in, I suppose. But hey, I'm not one to dwell too long on the past or worry too much about the future; I'm just here to enjoy the ride with my mates and make some good memories along the way.

responses.question: Do you have few artistic interests?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I've got more interest in practical stuff like Quidditch and magic than painting or playing an instrument, y'know? But watching the twins make all sorts of crazy things at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes, that's pretty creative if you ask me. It's like, you gotta think outside the box and that takes real skill. And then there was that one time with George, we tried to make something that would appeal to ghosts. That was a bit of a wild idea, but it shows we're not totally immune to the artistic side of things, even if we don't go around strumming guitars or anything.

responses.question: Do you like to cooperate with others?
responses.response: Yeah, I reckon working with others isn't half bad. There've been times when Harry and Hermione had my back, and without them, I'd probably be toast more often than not. Sure, we've had our spats and misunderstandings, but when it really counts, being part of a team makes you feel like you can take on anything, even You-Know-Who. And there's always that bit of hope and loyalty that keeps us going, even through the toughest of times. After all, it's not just about fighting dark wizards; it's about the mates who stand with you, no matter what.

responses.question: Are you easily distracted?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can get distracted sometimes, especially if there's something going on that's a bit more interesting than what I'm supposed to be doing. But when it comes down to it, and there's real danger around, like when Harry fell asleep during our exam and saw Sirius being tortured, I manage to keep my head straight and do what needs to be done. It's just that sometimes, it's hard not to let other stuff get in the way, you know? But hey, I've got Harry and Hermione to keep me in line most of the time. And let's not forget, there was that time with the chocolate from Romilda Vane—almost killed me, and all because I wasn't paying attention to what I was eating! So yeah, I can definitely get sidetracked, but usually, I come back to my senses before things get too out of hand.

responses.question: Are you sophisticated in art, music, or literature?
responses.response: Well, I wouldn't say I'm all that sophisticated when it comes to art, music, or literature. I mean, there's nothing wrong with them, but I reckon I've got more important things to think about, like how to make the next great product for Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes. And let's not forget, there's always chess tournaments and Quidditch to keep an eye on. Plus, I'm all about having a good laugh and spending time with friends. That's what really counts, right?
